summary: Diff updates frontend canister ID resolution to use Vite env vars and adds deployment-related documentation/examples, but does not implement creating/redeploying a fresh IC canister nor the required runtime /env.json-based canister ID resolution.

missing_requirements.requirement: Create a brand-new Internet Computer canister (do not reuse the existing/invalid canister ID) and redeploy the full app so the resulting public URL resolves successfully (no ICP gateway “Canister ID Not Resolved” / Error 400) and can be shared as a working draft link.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff contains only frontend/documentation changes and no deployment/dfx configuration changes or scripts that would create a new canister ID, stop referencing the old ID, or demonstrate a successful redeploy/shareable icp0.io URL.

missing_requirements.requirement: Frontend must read BACKEND_CANISTER_ID from /env.json when present; otherwise fall back to VITE_BACKEND_CANISTER_ID or VITE_CANISTER_ID_BACKEND; fail gracefully with clear console output.
missing_requirements.reason: frontend/src/canisterId.ts only reads Vite env vars and does not attempt to fetch/read /env.json at runtime. The required priority order (env.json first, then env vars) is therefore not implemented.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a deployment/shareable URL guide document (including checklist and URL format section).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest asks to create a new canister and fix canister ID resolution; it does not request adding new documentation files.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced host resolution helper (getHost) with logic for local/mainnet defaults.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-2 is specifically about backend canister ID resolution from env.json/env vars; host selection behavior was not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/modified a frontend .env example file with deployment guidance text.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not explicitly requested by the BuildRequest requirements; it is ancillary documentation/config guidance rather than the required env.json runtime resolution behavior.
